meanings.definition: To act as a lawyer or provide legal counsel.
meanings.sent1: She lawyered for her client in court.
meanings.sent2: The attorney lawyered the case with expertise.
meanings.sent3: He lawyered his way through the complex legal system.
meanings.sent4: She lawyered her argument like a seasoned professional.
meanings.sent5: The way she lawyered the contract negotiation was impressive.

meanings.definition: To engage in legal proceedings or litigation.
meanings.sent1: They lawyered up to defend their rights.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to lawyer the dispute.
meanings.sent3: He lawyered his way out of the tricky situation.
meanings.sent4: She lawyered the case as if it were a battle.
meanings.sent5: The defendant lawyered his defense with determination.

meanings.definition: To skillfully argue or debate a point.
meanings.sent1: She lawyered her position in the debate.
meanings.sent2: He lawyered his way to victory in the argument.
meanings.sent3: They lawyered back and forth on the issue.
meanings.sent4: The politician lawyered his stance with eloquence.
meanings.sent5: She lawyered her case persuasively during the discussion.
